poem:
### The Gatekeepers

In chambers of stone, they barter  
while iron shadows loom outside.  
Echoes of ancient names returned,  
Goths and Vandals, unseen ride.  
Absent the shepherd's watchful eye,  
wolves gather at Europe's hem.  
Yet, within those walls, the lords decree,  
blind to the wolf's condemning hymn.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The EU is under siege from present-day descendants of the Goths, Mongols and Vandals. But what were top MEPs doing? Haggling over who gets which well-padded seat in the European Commission – as if it really matters". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
